Class Vigenere

  • java.lang.Object
    • Vigenere

  • public class Vigenere
extends java.lang.Object
    Vigenere is a class that is used for Vigenere Cipher Encryption and Decryption. The way this type of encryption works is by using the letters of a message you enter and a keyword. Example: If you enter the message "apple" and your keyword is "lemon" the first letter in the encrypted message will be "l". Apple's first letter is easy for an example because what the encryption is doing is using the index of the letters. So the first letter for "apple" is "a" and the first letter for "lemon" is "l", therefore the index for "a" is 0 and the is index for "l" is 11. We then add these indexes together to get 11, and that is why the first letter of the encrypted message is "l". This is why having the vigenereGrid is vital because we can use it for all possible letter combinations.
    Author:
    Nick Grove

    • Field Detail

      • vigenereGrid

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.Character,java.util.Map<java.lang.Character,java.lang.Character>> vigenereGrid
        The vigenerGrid instance variable is based of the "Vigenere Table". The "Vigenere Table" is used for Vigenere Cipher Encryption and Decryption.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Vigenere

        Vigenere()
        Default Constructor

    • Method Detail

      • initGrid

        private void initGrid()
        Initializes the "Vigenere Table" or vigenereGrid. This method first goes about initializing the alphabet and then using that alphabet to put every possible letter combination into the vigenereGrid

      • matchKeywordSizeToMessage

        public char[] matchKeywordSizeToMessage(java.lang.String k,
                                        java.lang.String m)
        Returns the keyword put in a form that matches the message, so we can use the keyword for encryption/decryption. Whenever we need to encrypt/decrypt using the "Vigenere Table"(vigenereGrid), the keyword needs to match the message. Example: If our message is "Hello World" and our keyword is "Java", using this method our keyword becomes "JavaJ avaJa" to which is the same size and spacing as our message.
        Parameters:
        k - Represents the keyword for encryption/decryption
        m - Represents the message before encryption/decryption
        Returns:
        The keyword repeated to the correct size of the message and spaced to match the message

      • toCharArray

        private char[] toCharArray(java.lang.String s)
        Returns an inputted String as a char array.
        Parameters:
        s - Input String
        Returns:
        The input String as a char array

      • encrypt

        public java.lang.String encrypt(java.lang.String dM,
                                java.lang.String k)
        Returns a String that is the input message encrypted. To achieve this the method make a new char array and sets it to the same size as the decrypted message. It then loops, and using the decrypted message and keyword along with the vigenereGrid to assign the encrypted message its letters. Inside the loop spaces must be accounted for as well.
        Parameters:
        dM - Represents a decrypted message
        k - Represents a keyword
        Returns:
        Vigenere Cipher Encryption of the decrypted message using the keyword and the vigenereGrid

      • decrypt

        public java.lang.String decrypt(java.lang.String eM,
                                java.lang.String k)
        Returns a String that is the input message decrypted. Vigenere Dencryption is achieved by looping through the vigenereGrid to find the keyword letter, and then indexing to where the encrypted message's letter is. From doing this you have the map entry where the decrypted message letter is the key, therefore from here the method gets the key of the entry.
        Parameters:
        eM - Represents a encrypted message
        k - Represents a keyword
        Returns:
        Vigenere Cipher Dencryption of the encrypted message using the keyword and the vigenereGrid

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method of the class, the constantly loops to ask for a keyword and message. Once the keyword and message are entered in it encrypts the message and then decrypts back. This prints the encrypted message while also showing that the encryption and decryption work correctly.
        Parameters:
        args -
